text_section1.text: Charlie Graham's heart ached that day! At seventy, he could look back only on wasted years! But suddenly Charlie became important in the life of one man, in a life and death struggle against...
The Monster From 1977 A.D.
Billy Wyatt was Charlie Graham's favorite grand-nephew... and today was Billy's fourth birthday... but old Charlie wasn't very happy about it!

text_section2.text: What'd you get for my birfday, Unc' Charlie?

text_section3.text: Uh... nothin' yet, Billy boy! I'm sort of waitin' till I can find something extra special!

text_section1.text: Don't feel badly, Uncle Charlie! Your love for Billy is something money could never buy him!

text_section2.text: You can't explain that to a four year old boy, Martha! Everyone got him somethin' but me! That's what comes of chasin' rainbows all my life... I wound up flat broke! Flat broke and ashamed!

text_section1.text: Sometime later...

text_section2.text: The desert of New Mexico! How I used to love it! Spent my youth ridin' over it and dreamin'! The desert never gave me nothin'!! Now I hate it! Hate it!!

text_section1.text: And so, an old discouraged man lay back his head and tried to lose his bitterness in sleep when suddenly a weird, sharp cry startled him...

text_section2.text: What in...? Where in tarnation did that yell come from!?

text_section1.text: It's not comin' from town... nobody in sight, either! Huh! Must be goin' loco for sure... could've sword I heard...!

text_section2.text: I'm here on the desert! Three miles outside Mesa City!... Help! Help me!!

text_section1.text: By golly! There it is again! Three miles out of Mesa City? Why... that's right around here!! B-But I still don't see anybody!

text_section2.text: Quick! I'm being chased by a forty foot gila monster!

text_section1.text: Forty foot...?!! Well by George!! Now I know someone's pulling my leg! Forty foo --!

text_section2.text: Quickly! Hurry!! Hurry before it's too late!! Oh, please! Help meeeeee!!

text_section1.text: If whoever is doin' that, yellin' is pullin' an act, he's doin' a mighty fine job... That voice is scared an' it won't hurt to look behind the mesa!!
This is what I need! A little excitement, so's I can stop feelin' sorry for myself!! This is the medicine for me!
Wal, I can't see nothin' dangerous out here! A few prairie dogs an' a scared rattler... huh! I guess that's all we'll ever see, eh, blaze?
No! Please! Where are you, mister? I hear your voice close by! I'm near the foot of a Navajo mesa... on the north side!

text_section2.text: Nor--?! Why... Why that's where I am!!

text_section1.text: The north side of Navajo Mesa... that's where the voice said it was... and there is where it truly was... and there too was the forty foot gila monster! But where was Charlie Graham...?!

text_section2.text: I hear you! It's as though you were standing alongside me! Call out a little louder!!

text_section1.text: Call out?! Wait a minute, mister. How could you hear me when I was only thinkin' an' not talkin' out loud!

text_section2.text: Thinking? Great Scott! What -- what year is it where you are?

text_section1.text: Well of all the fool questions! It's 1958 o' course! That explains everythin'! You're jus' plain loco!

text_section2.text: No! Listen! I'm living in 1978! We're talking by thought communication across the time barrier!

text_section1.text: Listen! An atomic test in 1960 caused a mutation of genes in the gila monster and turned it into a deadly menace! He... he keeps gaining on me... I... I can't run much longer!
Bewildered, confused, Charlie Graham could almost feel the solid wall of terror pushing through the time span barrier...

text_section2.text: What about a gun?!

text_section3.text: Had 30 - 30 bullets... bounced like pebbles off it's hide!

text_section1.text: Friend, I sure would like to help you, but... but how? I don't see what I can do!

text_section2.text: Nor do I! I've just got to keep running... till... till I drop.

text_section1.text: But... there'll be others... others in danger! It sounds... crazy... but if I you can prevent that test in 1960, this... this will never happen...

text_section2.text: Say! That's right! But pshaw! Who'd listen to an ol' nobody like me an'... say! Hold on! By thunder! You've given me an idea, mister! Mebbe I can help you after all! Hang on, son!

text_section1.text: Wha... what... are... you... going to do?

text_section2.text: Mister, I'm goin' huntin'! Gila monster huntin'!

text_section1.text: Fanning out wide, Charlie rode in ever narrowing circles... around and around, tighter and tighter picking off every gila lizard he saw.
Nasty critters... bite like a bull dog, poisonous as a sidewinder... and still I hate doin' all this killin'... but a man's life is at stake! Sorry, you old lizard!
I... I understand what you're trying... trying to do... keep... it... up... it's still... after me...

text_section2.text: Don't give up boy! Keep goin'! I'll keep blastin' away till my bullets are gone!!

text_section1.text: Grimly hating his gory task, the old timer searched out every one of the striped reptiles...

text_section2.text: I haven't wasted a shot... only four slugs left! Oh, please, please! Let me find the right one!!

text_section1.text: And on almost the same spot... but twenty years later, a young man stumbles... and falls... exhausted... a sibilant hiss makes him open his eyes... try to get up...

text_section2.text: I -- I can't -- get... up... too... tired...

text_section1.text: Wait! He's disappearing! Disappeared! Gone... gone completely!! Y-you saved my life!!

text_section2.text: Thank heaven!! Well, mister, I figured if I could find the same gila that got that mutation blast an' kill it now... here in 1958, two years before the atomic test... it just couldn't exist there in '77 with you!!

text_section1.text: And you were right sir!! Lucky for me that gila was already born in 1958! If it hadn't been, you couldn't have killed it and... but it's over and I'd like to know whom to thank!!

text_section2.text: Pshaw! No thanks needed, friend! But my names Charlie Graham, what's yours?

text_section1.text: Uncle Charlie!! This is fantastic!! I'm your grand-nephew Billy Wyatt!! Just think...

text_section2.text: Billy! What...? Billy! He's gone!! I can't read him anymore!

text_section1.text: Contact between their minds totally broken off, Uncle Charlie spurred his horse home and when he walked in to face his young grand nephew there were tears of happiness in his eyes...

text_section2.text: I reckon I gave you the best gift a man can give someone he loves!

text_section1.text: You can't see it yet, Billy... but twenty years from now you'll know about it and then you'll remember your old Uncle Charlie... you'll remember and be glad that today I gave you your life!

text_section2.text: The end
